Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "How to integrate vue to WisdomTool REST Client?" (#7015) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
[WisdomTool REST Client](https://github.com/wisdomtool/rest-client) supports automated testing RESTful API and automatically generating RESTful API documentation.

Maybe we can use vue for WisdomTool REST Client to generate report and API docs.

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "Watch提供更高级的语法糖" (#7014) at vuejs/vue
Closed issue "v-for need empty tag for a group of element,something like ng-container with angular" (#7013) at vuejs/vue
Events.RelatedBody:
### What problem does this feature solve? Sometimes we don't really want a html element,for example in angular, we do loop like below,we don't want additional tag between ul and li,ng-cotainer solved the problem,is there any solution in Vue? ```
  • {{ book.title }}
  • {{ book.author }}
  • {{ book.price }}
    •
``` ### What does the proposed API look like? Just like angular solution

Events.RelatedDescription: Opened issue "declaration of beforeRouteEnter(to,from,next) hook should be updated" (#1863) at vuejs/vue-router
Events.RelatedBody:
### Version
3.0.1

### Reproduction link
[https://jsfiddle.net/doommm/50wL7mdz/74369/](https://jsfiddle.net/doommm/50wL7mdz/74369/)

### Steps to reproduce
Vue 2.5.3  
Typescript 2.6.1  
vscode 1.17.2, vetur 0.10.1

I found that in declaration file(`types/router.d.ts`), there's a type named `NavigationGuard` used for `beforeRouteEnter` and other two hooks. Its function declaration is `((vm: Vue) => any) | void) => void`, and should it be updated so we could access all members declared in class(or object)?
I wrote three examples to explain my confusion.
1. In .vue file with object literal style, i cant access my own properties.
2. In .vue file with `vue-class-component`, **if i add an type identifier manually, it works. no error.** if not, error.
3. In separate .ts file with `vue-class-component`, whether i add identifier or not, got error. **But if  i roll back to typescript 2.5.3, and add type identifier, it works.**

I think the declaration should be updated(Generics? `T extends Vue` or ?), but i'm not sure about that. Sorry for my poor english If I dont describe the problem clearly.


### What is expected?
all class(object) members should be accessed in vm.

### What is actually happening?
We could only access members of Vue.

<!-- generated by vue-issues. DO NOT REMOVE -->

Events.RelatedBody: Description of the `watch()` function is not accurate, [getter receives two arguments](https://github.com/vuejs/vuex/blob/dev/src/store.js#L150).
